p: Isolated terpenoids from S. nervosum are mostly oleanane- ( 6– 9, 26– 33) and ursane-type ( 1– 5, 10– 20) triterpenoids. Oleanane-type triterpenoid is also known as β-amyrin triterpenoid, which consists of five six-membered rings (A-E) with trans-conformation of A/B, B/C, and C/ D rings and cis-conformation of D/E rings. Ursane-type triterpenoid ( α-amyrin type) is nearly identical to oleanane-type from a chemical perspective, except for two methyls at C-19 and C-20 (in oleanane-type, both methyls connect to C-20).
